d.title: Issue: Work time on-line hours
d.body:
Hi Rem,
sorry for this message but i find issue on work time on-line hours.

So i see in the demo you have insert 0 - 0 - 24 - 0 and it work, chat are always on-line but i try to put on-line the chat from 17 - 30 to )18 - 0 or 18 - 30) and not work.

 have also tried to put on-line demo chat only for one hour but same to not work, settings are saved but live chat is offline. Can you check and let me know?

So for reproduce try to set up on-line hours chat from one hours to another and from an hours and 30 minutes to other hours example start time 17:30 end time 18:00 (tested and not work, chat will be still offline) operator have to be in offline mode.

Many thanks.

d.title: Feature Request: Customize Validation Error Message and Hide "Cancel" Button
d.body: **Description:** Hello Remi, I am using the "Collect custom attribute" feature in the chatbot builder and have identified two areas that could be significantly improved: **1. Inability to Customize the Validation Error Message:** Currently, when a user enters information that does not match the specified "Preg match rule," a default, non-editable error message is displayed: "Your message does not match..." This presents a challenge as the generic message can be unclear to users and does not allow for providing specific guidance or brand-aligned communication. **Desired Behavior:** I would like the ability to edit the validation error message. This would allow for more user-friendly and context-specific feedback. For example, I could provide a clearer instruction or a message in the brand's tone of voice. **2. "Cancel" Button Remains Visible After Use:** I have enabled the "Cancel button on failed validation" option, which is a helpful feature. When the user clicks "Cancel," the pre-configured trigger is correctly executed. However, the "Cancel" button itself remains visible in the chat interface even after the cancellation action has been completed and a new trigger has been initiated. This can be confusing for the user, as the button appears to be a persistent, yet irrelevant, option. **Desired Behavior:** The "Cancel" button should be automatically hidden or removed from the chat interface after it has been clicked and the corresponding cancellation trigger has been executed. This would create a cleaner and more intuitive user experience. Thank you for considering these feature enhancements. They would greatly improve the flexibility and user-friendliness of the chatbot builder.

d.title: Issue with existing or new start chat setting...
d.body:
I did a Live Helper Chat update to 4.16 and a new install and the issue applies to both. On a new install, if I create a new start chat setting and save it, that results in the contents of a chat widget being blank when opened/started.  Inspecting the php log file showed an error "Invalid JSON" in the SQL using JSON_CONTAINS [persistent_session.php:833]. Looking at the database, the dep_ids of lh_chat_start_settings is an empty string causing a problem for JSON_CONTAINS. When I go edit the recently created start chat setting and save it, that fixes the issue and looking at the database dep_ids is now an empty JSON array '[]' and the chat widget works as it should. 

Similarly, doing an update from a previous version, prior to version 4.12, adds the dep_ids field to the existing lh_chat_start_settings and they are all an empty string which results in the same SQL error and breaking the chat widget. I can think of various ways to address this issue, but the easy solution for myself, after updating to 4.16, was to run the SQL 
update `lh_chat_start_settings`
	set dep_ids='[]'
where dep_ids='' 

This won't fix when subsequently creating new start chat settings which will have an empty string for dep_ids, but I could run the SQL again or edit the new start chat settings again to have the system set it properly to [].

Hope this makes some sense, helps others, and the community can address the issue appropriately. 

For reference...
Update_284.sql - ALTER TABLE `lh_chat_start_settings` ADD `dep_ids` text NOT NULL, COMMENT='';

Thank you for your excellent hard work.

d.title: Issue - Department close time not taking affect if operators logged in
d.body:
I have configured a close time on my default department and this works to change the widget from Online to Offline, i have configured the widget to do this and prompt to leave a message when the department is closed.

I have also checked the box to ignore operators logged in statuses and use department opening times.

But, if a customer clicks on the widget it will still allow them to start a chat if an operation is logged in to the backend.

d.title: BUG: chat transcript not work if survey are active after the chat.
d.body:
How to reproduce:
1 create survey
2. create embed live chat code with survey
3. start a chat and chat say Hi as operator
4. say Hi as visitor
5. send a predefied message (canned message)
6. close the chat from operator side (end)
7. vote the chat
8. ask for chat transcript

results: not work - you can put your email but when press send the pop up not close and no email are sent

Tested also in the demo.

d.title: when nodejs support is enabled, transferred chats do not appear on "target" operator
d.body:
When the nodejs support is used and the chat is transferred, the chat does not appear on the screen of the "target" operator. The chat appears when the page is refreshed. It also seems to appear when the connection to livehelperchat php application gets timed out by web server (in Apache, "Timeout" parameter).

 When nodejs is not running and chat is transferred, it appears in few seconds.

d.title: Voice message length cannot be changed from 30 seconds
d.body:
Hi, thank you very much for this great tool, and for making this opensource. 
I'm attempting to use the voice message feature. The feature is working fine, except for the fact that I cannot change the max message length. When navigating to the visitor view, the message send container always indicates 30seconds, and a longer message cannot be left. This is despite changing the max messaged length in site_admin/file/configuration

Any ideas what I might be doing wrong ?
Thanks in advance,
